WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The claw radical and the claw kanji are exactly the same! Ravishing!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Youâ€™ve got not one tumor (ã¤ã¾), but too many (ã¤ã‚) tumors and you need to claw them out with your sharp claw. One tumor is one tumor too many. Cut them out with your claw!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine you have too many tumors. Feel the claw digging into your flesh and removing the tumors. It really hurts, but it is necessary.

humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The downward hand of the oracle bone inscription , that is, the shape of the covering hand. The inscription " claw " from the hand from â—, like a hand, â— like a sharp finger claw. Can be understood as the fingers of birds, animals or people.

"Shuowen": "Chang Ye, cover your hands and call claws." " Chun " has the meaning of holding, so " claws " also mean to take. The characters " claws " in oracle bones and inscriptions are rarely seen, and they are often used as parts, such as " Fang ", which resembles the shape of a covering hand to show that the hand is used to fetch objects. There is the term "minions" in the bronze inscriptions, using sharp claws and fangs as a metaphor to indicate powerful military officials. Shi Kezhen: "Defend (defend) the (imperial) king's body, turn (make) the minions." "Poetry. "Pray for Father": "Pray for Father! To the king's minions." "Zuo Zhuan. "Twelve Years of Cheng Gong": "Thinking that one's heart, thighs, and claws." After adding hands, the word " grabbing " is added, which means grabbing . " Claw " and " ugly " are the same, refer to " ugly " and " fork ".
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The downward hand of the oracle bone inscription , that is, the shape of the covering hand. The inscription " claw " from the hand from â—, like a hand, â— like a sharp finger claw. Can be understood as the fingers of birds, animals or people.

ç”²éª¨æ–‡è±¡å‘ä¸‹çš„æ‰‹ï¼Œå³è¦†æ‰‹ä¹‹å½¢ã€‚é‡‘æ–‡ã€Œ çˆª ã€å¾æ‰‹å¾â—ï¼Œè±¡æ‰‹å½¢ï¼Œâ—è±¡é‹’åˆ©çš„æŒ‡çˆªã€‚å¯ç†è§£ç‚ºé³¥ç¸æˆ–äººçš„æŒ‡çˆªã€‚ ã€Šèªªæ–‡ã€‹ï¼šã€Œä¸®ä¹Ÿï¼Œè¦†æ‰‹æ›°çˆªã€‚ã€ã€Œ ä¸® ã€æœ‰åŸ·æŒä¹‹ç¾©ï¼Œæ•…ã€Œ çˆª ã€äº¦æœ‰æ‹¿å–ä¹‹æ„ã€‚ç”²éª¨ã€é‡‘æ–‡ã€Œ çˆª ã€å­—å°‘è¦‹ï¼Œå¤šç”¨ä½œéƒ¨ä»¶ï¼Œå¦‚ã€Œ çˆ« ã€ï¼Œè±¡è¦†æ‰‹ä¹‹å½¢ï¼Œä»¥ç¤ºè¦†æ‰‹å–ç‰©ã€‚é‡‘æ–‡ä¸­æœ‰ã€Œçˆªç‰™ã€ä¸€èªï¼Œä»¥é‹’çˆªåˆ©ç‰™ä¾†ä½œæ¯”å–»ï¼Œè¡¨ç¤ºå¾—åŠ›ä¹‹æ­¦è‡£ã€‚å¸«å…‹ç›¨ï¼šã€Œå¹²(æ)å®³(ç¦¦)ç‹èº«ï¼Œä¹(ä½œ)çˆªç‰™ã€‚ã€ã€Šè©©ï¼ç¥ˆçˆ¶ã€‹ï¼šã€Œç¥ˆçˆ¶ï¼äºˆç‹ä¹‹çˆªç‰™ã€‚ã€ã€Šå·¦å‚³ï¼æˆå…¬åäºŒå¹´ã€‹ï¼šã€Œä»¥ç‚ºå·±è…¹å¿ƒã€è‚¡è‚±ã€çˆªç‰™ã€‚ã€å¾ŒåŠ æ‰‹ç´¯å¢ã€Œ æŠ“ ã€å­—ï¼Œè¡¨ç¤ºæ“’æ‹¿ã€‚ã€Œ çˆª ã€ã€ã€Œ ä¸‘ ã€å½¢åŒï¼Œåƒã€Œ ä¸‘ ã€ã€ã€Œ å‰ ã€ã€‚
Elaboration: The downward hand of the oracle bone inscription, that is, the shape of the covering hand. The inscription " claw" from the hand from â—, like a hand, â— like a sharp finger claw. Can be understood as the fingers of birds, animals or people. "Shuowen": "Chang Ye, cover your hands and call claws." " Chun" has the meaning of holding, so " claws" also mean to take. The characters " claws" in oracle bones and inscriptions are rarely seen, and they are often used as parts, such as " Fang", which resembles the shape of a covering hand to show that the hand is used to fetch objects. There is the term "minions" in the bronze inscriptions, using sharp claws and fangs as a metaphor to indicate powerful military officials. Shi Kezhen: "Defend (defend) the (imperial) king's body, turn (make) the minions." "Poetry. "Pray for Father": "Pray for Father! To the king's minions." "Zuo Zhuan. "Twelve Years of Cheng Gong": "Thinking that one's heart, thighs, and claws." After adding hands, the word " grabbing" is added, which means grabbing. " Claw" and " ugly" are the same, refer to " ugly" and " fork".

claw
Basic explanation of words
claw
zhÇo
Nail or toenail: There are claws at the end of the toe.
The toes of birds and beasts: eagle claws. Minions (Yu Dangyu, dog legs). A scale and half claws.
Grab.
claw
zhuÇ
Animal's feet (many fingers with pointed armor): chicken paws. Dog paw.
Something like claws, this pot has three claws.
claw
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[â‘ ] [zhuÇ] [zhÇo]
["Guangyun" side-cut, Qiao, Zhuang. ]
"Scratch 3" was passed falsely. "Flea 2" is a false word.
(1) Birds and animals have pointed toes on their toes. Also refers to its sharp toenails.
(2) By extension, it refers to the claw-shaped part of the utensil.
(3) Human nails. Also refers to fingers or hands.
(4) Cut nails or toenails.
(5) Pinched with nails.
(6) Yu the guardian.
(7) Grab and scratch.
(8) Capture.
(9) Still stupid.
(10) Same as "find". See "Claw Search".
claw
English translation of words
â— Claw
armature, claw, talon, unguis
claw

ã€”å¤æ–‡ã€•ã•šã€Tang Yunã€‘ã€Ji Yunã€‘? Side twisting, sound grasping. [Said Wen] Cover your hands and say claws. ã€PoetryÂ·Xiaoyaã€‘Pray for the minions of father and son. ã€Zhou LiÂ·Dongguan Kao Gong JiÂ·Zi Renã€‘Anyone who grabs a handicraft or the like must deepen their claws, get out of their eyes, and make their scales. [Guang Yun] Arms and feet. ã€Ji Yunã€‘This is a ã•š. Or as a flea scratch. â—According to the rhyme, it will be said that the claw is originally the claw of the grasping claw, not the hand and foot. It's too roundabout to follow.ã€€[Ji Yun] [Class Chapter]? Blocking cut, sound ç¬Š. [Jiyun] Cover your hands and fetch things. One said that it is too.
claw
Source glyph
claw
Name meaning
Refers to the feet of beasts (mostly with pointed armor), and also refers to things like claws.
